keys.name: remoteip
keys.documentation: IP address of the connected client

keys.name: remoteptr
keys.documentation: Reverse DNS (FCrDNS) for remoteip (not always available)

keys.name: remoteuid
keys.documentation: UNIX socket remote user id (not always available)

keys.name: proxyip
keys.documentation: IP address of the proxy server (not always available)

connect.name: $senderip
connect.documentation: IP address of the connected client

keys.name: close
keys.documentation: Who initialized the disconnect (local or remote)

keys.name: state
keys.documentation: An enum to indicate which issued SMTP command triggerd the disconnect

keys.name: type
keys.documentation: The type of error (if avilable, socket or tls)

keys.name: code
keys.documentation: The error code (for socket it's an errno and for tls it's an OpenSSL error code)

keys.name: remoteip
keys.documentation: IP address of the connected client

keys.name: remoteptr
keys.documentation: Reverse DNS (FCrDNS) for remoteip (not always available)

keys.name: peercert
keys.documentation: The peer certificate (if provided by the client)

keys.name: x509
keys.documentation: An X509Resource to be used with the X509 class

keys.name: error
keys.documentation: The peer certificate validation error (see OpenSSLs SSL_get_verify_result(3))

helo.name: $saslauthed
helo.documentation: Whether or not the SMTP session is authenticated (SASL)

keys.name: username
keys.documentation: SASL username (only available with LOGIN or PLAIN)

keys.name: password
keys.documentation: SASL password (only available with LOGIN or PLAIN)

keys.name: state
keys.documentation: SASL state, incremeted per Reply (not available with LOGIN or PLAIN)

keys.name: response
keys.documentation: SASL response (not available with LOGIN or PLAIN)

eodrcpt.documentation: List of all domain part of all recipient addresses (envelope)

keys.name: transportid
keys.documentation: ID of the transport profile to be used

keys.name: original
keys.documentation: An FileResource to be used with the File class

keys.name: modified
keys.documentation: An FileResource to be used with the File class

keys.name: notify
keys.documentation: The DSN NOTIFY options (NEVER, SUCCESS, FAILURE or DELAY)

predelivery.name: $context
predelivery.documentation: Delivery attempt-bound variable. It is only passed between pre and post-delivery.

predelivery.name: $serverid
predelivery.documentation: ID of the server the message was received on

predelivery.name: $receivedtime
predelivery.documentation: The unix time (in UTC) when the message was received

predelivery.name: $transportid
predelivery.documentation: ID of the transport profile assigned

predelivery.name: $retries
predelivery.documentation: The maximum number of retries for that message

predelivery.name: $sourceip
predelivery.documentation: The delivery source IP (initially defined by the transport profile)

predelivery.name: $destination
predelivery.documentation: The destination host (initially defined by the transport profile)

predelivery.name: $destinationport
predelivery.documentation: The destination port (initially defined by the transport profile)

keys.name: action
keys.documentation: The default action of this execution ("DELETE", "BOUNCE", "QUEUE"). Missing on successful deliveries.

keys.name: policy
keys.documentation: The pickup policy information (if an attempt was made)

keys.name: attempt
keys.documentation: The delivery attempt result (if an attempt was made)

keys.name: state
keys.documentation: An enum to indicate which issued SMTP command triggerd the result

keys.name: error
keys.documentation: A generic eror message (if no SMTP result)

keys.name: temporary
keys.documentation: If the error may be transient

keys.name: x509
keys.documentation: An X509Resource to be used with the X509 class

keys.name: dsn
keys.documentation: The DSN action and a DSN message id (if generated).

keys.name: action
keys.documentation: DSN type to be generated (delayed, failed, relayed or delivered)

keys.name: id
keys.documentation: ID of the DSN message to be generated

postdelivery.name: $message
postdelivery.documentation: The queued message (with modifications from pre-delivery)

keys.name: transportid
keys.documentation: ID of the transport profile to be used

keys.name: original
keys.documentation: An FileResource to be used with the File class

keys.name: modified
keys.documentation: An FileResource to be used with the File class

keys.name: notify
keys.documentation: The DSN NOTIFY options (NEVER, SUCCESS, FAILURE or DELAY)

postdelivery.name: $context
postdelivery.documentation: This variable is only defined if the pre-delivery has been executed

postdelivery.name: $receivedtime
postdelivery.documentation: The unix time (in UTC) when the message was received

postdelivery.name: $transportid
postdelivery.documentation: ID of the transport profile that was used

postdelivery.name: $retries
postdelivery.documentation: The maximum number of retries for that message

postdelivery.name: $action
postdelivery.documentation: The default action of this execution ("DELETE", "BOUNCE", "RETRY" or "")

postdelivery.name: $errormsg
postdelivery.documentation: The error message from the server

postdelivery.name: $errorcode
postdelivery.documentation: The error code from the server (A value 0 of indicates network problems)

postdelivery.name: $errorndr
postdelivery.documentation: The NDR code from the server (if available)

postdelivery.name: $transfertime
postdelivery.documentation: The transfer time for this delivery attempt (seconds)

postdelivery.name: $serverip
postdelivery.documentation: IP which we tried to connect to (empty on DNS problems)

postdelivery.name: $serverport
postdelivery.documentation: Port which we tried to connect to

api.name: $clientip
api.documentation: The IP address of the client

api.name: $soapcall
api.documentation: The SOAP function that is executed

api.name: $soapargs
api.documentation: The SOAP function arguments (not always available)

firewall.name: $family
firewall.documentation: IP family of connecting client ("ipv4" or "ipv6")

firewall.name: $protocol
firewall.documentation: IP protocol of local server ("tcp" or "udp")
